00001 /* 
00002  * jcom.out~
00003  * External for Jamoma: manage audio outputs for a module
00004  * By Tim Place, Copyright © 2006
00005  * 
00006  * License: This code is licensed under the terms of the GNU LGPL
00007  * http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.html 
00008  */
00009 
00010 
00011 /*
00012         The user specifies @channel_config mono or @channel_config stereo 
00013         as arg to the module.  That makes the hub responsible for cleaning
00014         up an unused inlets and outlets for the configuration.  
00015         
00016         It may also signal to the module to handle the poly differently,
00017         i.e. if the algorithm should be true stereo instead of multi-mono
00018         
00019         This all means that we need this object to subscribe to the hub.
00020 */
00021 
00022 
00023 #include "Jamoma.h"
00024 #include "jcom.out.h"
00025 
00026 #define POLL_INTERVAL   150                     // metro time
00027 
00028 // Globals
00029 t_class         *out_class;                                     // Required. Global pointing to this class
00030 
00031 
00032 /************************************************************************************/
00033 // Main() Function
00034 
00035 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00036 {
00037         long            attrflags = 0;
00038         t_class         *c;
00039         t_object        *attr = NULL;
00040         long            offset;
00041         
00042         jamoma_init();
00043 
00044         // Define our class
00045 #ifdef JCOM_OUT_TILDE
00046         c = class_new("jcom.out~",(method)out_new, (method)out_free, (short)sizeof(t_out), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00047 #else
00048         c = class_new("jcom.out",(method)out_new, (method)out_free, (short)sizeof(t_out), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00049 #endif
00050 
00051         offset = calcoffset(t_out, common);
00052         class_obexoffset_set(c, offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common, obex));
00053 
00054         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00055         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_dispatched,                      "dispatched",                   A_GIMME, 0L);
00056         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_algorithm_message,       "algorithm_message",    A_GIMME, 0L);
00057         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_link_to_in_object,       "link_in",                              A_CANT, 0L);
00058         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_unlink,                          "unlink_in",                    0L);
00059         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_register_meter,          "register_meter",               A_CANT, 0L);
00060         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_remove_meters,           "remove_meters",                A_CANT, 0L);
00061         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_register_preview,        "register_preview",             A_CANT, 0L);
00062 #ifdef JCOM_OUT_TILDE
00063         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_getAudioForChannel,      "getAudioForChannel",   A_CANT, 0);
00064         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_dsp,                                     "dsp",                                  A_CANT, 0L);
00065 #else
00066         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_anything,                        "anything",                             A_GIMME, 0L);
00067         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_sendbypassedvalue,       "sendbypassedvalue",    A_CANT, 0L);
00068         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_sendlastvalue,           "sendlastvalue",                A_CANT, 0L);
00069 #endif
00070         class_addmethod(c, (method)out_release,                         "release",                              A_CANT, 0L);    // notification of hub being freed
00071     class_addmethod(c, (method)out_assist,                              "assist",                               A_CANT, 0L);
00072 
00073         jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_common(c, attr, offset); 
00074         
00075         // ATTRIBUTE: algorithm_type
00076         attr = attr_offset_new("algorithm_type", _sym_symbol, attrflags,
00077                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_out, attr_algorithm_type));
00078         class_addattr(c, attr);
00079         
00080         // ATTRIBUTE: num_inputs
00081         attr = attr_offset_new("num_outputs", _sym_long, attrflags,
00082                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_out, num_outputs));
00083         class_addattr(c, attr); 
00084 
00085 #ifdef JCOM_OUT_TILDE
00086         // Setup our class to work with MSP
00087         class_dspinit(c);
00088 #endif 
00089 
00090         // Finalize our class
00091         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00092         out_class = c;
00093         return 0;
00094 }

00097 /************************************************************************************/
00098 // Object Life
00099 
00100 // Create
00101 void *out_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00102 {
00103         long            attrstart = attr_args_offset(argc, argv);               // support normal arguments
00104         t_out           *x = (t_out *)object_alloc(out_class);
00105         short           i;
00106 
00107         if(x){
00108                 x->dumpout = outlet_new(x, NULL);
00109                 object_obex_store((void *)x, ps_dumpout, (object *)x->dumpout);         // setup the dumpout
00110 
00111                 x->num_outputs =  1;
00112                 x->vector_size = 0;
00113                 x->attr_preview = 0;
00114                 x->preview_object = NULL;
00115                 x->attr_bypass = 0;
00116                 x->attr_mute = 0;
00117                 x->attr_algorithm_type = _sym_nothing;
00118                 if(attrstart > 0){
00119                         int argument = atom_getlong(argv);
00120                         x->num_outputs = tt_audio_base::clip(argument, 0, MAX_NUM_CHANNELS);
00121                 }
00122 #ifdef JCOM_OUT_TILDE
00123                 if(x->num_outputs > 0)
00124                         dsp_setup((t_pxobject *)x, x->num_outputs);             // Create Object and Inlets
00125                 else
00126                         dsp_setup((t_pxobject *)x, 1);                                  // Create Object and Inlets
00127                         
00128                 x->common.ob.z_misc = Z_NO_INPLACE | Z_PUT_LAST;        // Z_PUT_LAST so that thispoly~ gets it's message properly?             
00129                 for(i=0; i < (x->num_outputs); i++)
00130                         outlet_new((t_pxobject *)x, "signal");                  // Create a signal Outlet               
00131 
00132                 x->clock = clock_new(x, (method)update_meters);
00133                 x->clock_is_set = 0;
00134                 x->signal_in = new tt_audio_signal;
00135                 x->signal_out = new tt_audio_signal;
00136                 x->signal_temp = new tt_audio_signal;
00137                 x->xfade = new tt_crossfade;
00138                 x->gain = new tt_gain;
00139                 x->ramp_gain = new tt_ramp;
00140                 x->ramp_xfade = new tt_ramp;
00141                 out_alloc(x, sys_getblksize());                                         // allocates the vectors for the audio signals
00142 #else
00143                 for(i=x->num_outputs-1; i >= 1; i--)
00144                         x->inlet[i] = proxy_new(x, i, 0L);
00145                 for(i=x->num_outputs-1; i >= 0; i--)
00146                         x->outlet[i] = outlet_new(x, 0L);
00147 #endif          
00148                 jcom_core_subscriber_new_common(&x->common, ps__jcom_out__, ps_subscribe_out);
00149                 jcom_core_subscriber_setcustomsubscribe_method(&x->common, &out_subscribe);
00150                 
00151                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                                       // handle attribute args                                
00152                 defer_low(x, (method)jcom_core_subscriber_subscribe, 0, 0, 0);
00153         }
00154         return (x);                                                                                             // Return the pointer
00155 }

00158 // deferred function for registering with the jcom.hub object
00159 void out_subscribe(void *z)
00160 {
00161         long            argc;
00162         t_atom          a;
00163         t_atom          *argv = &a;
00164         t_symbol        *result;
00165         t_symbol        *modtype;
00166         t_out           *x = (t_out *)z;
00167         
00168         //x->common.hub = jcom_core_subscribe(x, x->common.attr_name, x->common.container, ps_subscribe_out);
00169         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00170                 object_attr_getvalueof(x->common.hub, ps_name, &argc, &argv);
00171                 x->common.module_name = atom_getsym(argv);
00172                 x->num_meter_objects = 0;
00173                 
00174                 // Find out what type of algorithm this is supposed to control
00175                 object_attr_getvalueof(x->common.hub, ps_algorithm_type, &argc, &argv);
00176                 result = atom_getsym(argv);
00177                 if(result == ps_default){
00178                         object_attr_getvalueof(x->common.hub, ps_module_type, &argc, &argv);
00179                         modtype = atom_getsym(argv);
00180                 
00181                         if(modtype == ps_audio)
00182                                 x->attr_algorithm_type = ps_poly;
00183                         else if(modtype == ps_video)
00184                                 x->attr_algorithm_type = ps_jitter;
00185                         else
00186                                 x->attr_algorithm_type = ps_control;
00187                 }
00188                 else
00189                         x->attr_algorithm_type = result;
00190         }
00191 }

00194 // Destroy
00195 void out_free(t_out *x)
00196 {
00197 #ifdef JCOM_OUT_TILDE
00198         dsp_free((t_pxobject *)x);                      // Always call dsp_free first in this routine
00199         freeobject((t_object *)x->clock);       // delete our clock
00200         
00201         delete x->signal_in;
00202         delete x->signal_out;
00203         delete x->signal_temp;
00204         delete x->xfade;
00205         delete x->gain;
00206         delete x->ramp_gain;
00207         delete x->ramp_xfade;
00208 #endif
00209         jcom_core_subscriber_common_free(&x->common);
00210 }
00211 
00212 
00213 // Notification that the hub no longer exists
00214 void out_release(t_out *x)
00215 {
00216         short i;
00217         
00218         jcom_core_subscriber_hubrelease(&x->common);    
00219         x->in_object = NULL;
00220         for(i=0; i<MAX_NUM_CHANNELS; i++)
00221                 x->meter_object[i] = NULL;
00222         x->num_meter_objects = 0;
00223         x->preview_object = NULL;
00224 }

00227 /************************************************************************************/
00228 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00229 
00230 // Method for Assistance Messages
00231 void out_assist(t_out *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00232 {
00233         if(msg==1)      // Inlets
00234                 strcpy(dst, "(signal) connect to the module algorithm");
00235         else if(msg==2){ // Outlets
00236                 if(arg < x->num_outputs) strcpy(dst, "(signal) connect to the module's outlets");
00237                 else strcpy(dst, "dumpout");
00238         }
00239 }

00241 
00242 // messages received from jcom.hub for the algorithm
00243 void out_algorithm_message(t_out *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00244 {
00245         if(argc < 2)
00246                 return;
00247                 
00248         if(argv->a_type == A_SYM){
00249                 if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_audio_gain_midi) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_audio_gain_midi)){
00250                         // Do gain control here...
00251                         // Should be that the gain change triggers a short tt_ramp to the new value
00252                         x->attr_gain = atom_getfloat(argv+1);   // store as midi values
00253                         x->gain->set_attr(tt_gain::k_gain, (x->attr_gain - 127) * .6);          // convert midi to db for tap_gain                      
00254                 }
00255                 else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_audio_mute) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_audio_mute)){
00256                         x->attr_mute = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00257                         if(x->attr_mute)
00258                                 x->gain->set_attr(tt_gain::k_gain_direct, 0.);
00259                         else 
00260                                 x->gain->set_attr(tt_gain::k_gain, (x->attr_gain - 127)  * .6);                 
00261                 }
00262                 else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_audio_bypass) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_audio_bypass)){
00263                         x->attr_bypass = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00264                         if(x->attr_bypass == 0)
00265                                 x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_position, x->attr_mix * 0.01);
00266                         else
00267                                 x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_position, 0.0);
00268                 }
00269                 else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_audio_mix) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_audio_mix)){
00270                         x->attr_mix = atom_getfloat(argv+1);
00271                         if(x->attr_bypass == 0)
00272                                 x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_position, x->attr_mix * 0.01);                       
00273                 }
00274                 else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_audio_sample_rate) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_audio_sample_rate)){
00275                         ;
00276                 }
00277                 else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_audio_meters_freeze) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_audio_meters_freeze)){
00278                         x->attr_defeat_meters = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00279                 }
00280                 else if((argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_video_preview) || (argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_slash_video_preview))
00281                         x->attr_preview = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00282         }
00283 }

00297 void out_register_meter(t_out *x, int meternum, void *meter_object)
00298 {
00299         x->meter_object[meternum] = meter_object;
00300         if((meternum+1) > x->num_meter_objects)
00301                 x->num_meter_objects = meternum+1;
00302 }

00305 void out_remove_meters(t_out *x)
00306 {
00307         short i;
00308         for(i=0; i<MAX_NUM_CHANNELS; i++)
00309                 x->meter_object[i] = NULL;
00310         x->num_meter_objects = 0;
00311 }

00327 // messages received from jcom.in
00328 void out_sendbypassedvalue(t_out *x, short inletnum, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00329 {
00330         if(inletnum < x->num_outputs)
00331                 outlet_anything(x->outlet[inletnum], msg, argc, argv);
00332 }

00334 
00335 void out_sendlastvalue(t_out *x)
00336 {
00337         // we need to cache the most recently sent values for this to work...
00338         // in the case of jitter, i guess we need to cache a *copy* of a Jitter matrix
00339         // ick
00340         // or maybe we just send the matrix name as passed in from this out objects inlets
00341         // because it shouldn't have changed since input to the algorithm is turned off...
00342         short i;
00343 
00344         for(i=0; i< x->num_outputs; i++)
00345                 outlet_anything(x->outlet[i], x->last_msg[i], x->last_argc[i], x->last_argv[i]);
00346 }
00347 
00348 
00349 void out_anything(t_out *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00350 {
00351         short inletnum = proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x);
00352         x->last_msg[inletnum] = msg;
00353         x->last_argc[inletnum] = argc;
00354         sysmem_copyptr(argv, x->last_argv[inletnum], argc * sizeof(t_atom));
00355         
00356         if(x->attr_preview == 1){
00357                 if(msg == _sym_jit_matrix){
00358                         object_method_typed(x->preview_object, _sym_jit_matrix, argc, argv, NULL);
00359                 }
00360         }
00361         outlet_anything(x->outlet[inletnum], msg, argc, argv);
00362 }
00363 
00364 
00365 void update_meters(t_out *x)
00366 {
00367         short   i;
00368         t_atom  a[2];
00369         
00370         for(i=0; i < x->num_meter_objects; i++){
00371                 if(x->meter_object[i]){
00372                         atom_setsym(&a[0], _sym_float);
00373                         atom_setfloat(&a[1], x->peakamp[i]);
00374                         object_method_typed(x->meter_object[i], ps_dispatched, 2, a, NULL);
00375                 }
00376         }
00377         x->clock_is_set = 0;
00378 }
00379 
00380 
00381 // Perform Method - just pass the whole vector straight through
00382 // (the work is all done in the dsp method)
00383 t_int *out_perform(t_int *w)
00384 {
00385         t_out           *x              = (t_out *)(w[1]);                      // Object Struct
00386         short           i               = (short)(w[2]);                        // Channel Number (zero-based)
00387         short           n               = (int)(w[5]);
00388         float           *sig    = (t_float *)(w[4]);
00389         float           currentvalue = 0, peakvalue = 0;        // values for calculating metering
00390         x->signal_in->set_vector((t_float *)(w[3]));    // Input Wet
00391         x->signal_out->set_vector(sig);                                 // Output
00392         x->signal_in->set_vectorsize(n);                                // Vector Size
00393 
00394         if(x->attr_bypass){
00395                 while(n--)
00396                         *sig++ = *(x->in_object->signal_in[i]->vector++);
00397                 x->in_object->signal_in[i]->reset();    
00398                 goto out;
00399         }
00400         
00401         if(x->attr_mute){
00402                 while(n--)
00403                         *sig++ = 0;
00404                 goto out;
00405         }
00406 
00407         if(x->in_object)
00408                 x->xfade->dsp_vector_calc(x->in_object->signal_in[i], x->signal_in, x->signal_temp);    // perform bypass/mix control
00409         x->gain->dsp_vector_calc(x->signal_temp, x->signal_out);                                                                // perform gain control
00410 
00411         if(x->attr_defeat_meters == 0){
00412                 while(n--){
00413                         currentvalue = ((*sig) < 0)?-(*sig):*sig; // get the current sample's absolute value
00414                         if(currentvalue > peakvalue)                                    // if it's a new peak amplitude...
00415                                 peakvalue = currentvalue;
00416                         sig++;                                                                          // increment pointer in the vector
00417                 }
00418                 if(peakvalue != x->peakamp[i]){                                 // filter out repetitions
00419                         x->peakamp[i] = peakvalue;
00420                         if(x->clock_is_set == 0){
00421                                 clock_delay(x->clock, POLL_INTERVAL);           // start the clock
00422                                 x->clock_is_set = 1;
00423                         }
00424                 }
00425         }
00426 out:
00427         return(w+6);
00428 }
00429 
00430 
00431 t_int *out_perform_zero(t_int *w)
00432 {
00433         t_float *out    = (t_float *)(w[1]);    // Output
00434         long    n               = (long)(w[2]);                 // vectorsize
00435 
00436         while(n--)
00437                 *out++ = 0;
00438         return(w+3);
00439 }

00442 void out_getAudioForChannel(t_out *x, int channel, float **vector)
00443 {
00444         *vector = x->out_vectors[channel];
00445 }

00447 
00448 // DSP Method
00449 void out_dsp(t_out *x, t_signal **sp, short *count)
00450 {
00451         short   i;
00452         int     vs = sp[0]->s_n;                        // Vector Size
00453         int             sr = sp[0]->s_sr;                       // Sample Rate  
00454 
00455         x->ramp_gain->set_sr(sr);
00456         x->ramp_xfade->set_sr(sr);
00457         out_alloc(x, vs);
00458 
00459         for(i=0; i < x->num_outputs; i++){                      // take a look at each
00460                 x->out_vectors[i] = sp[i]->s_vec;
00461                 if(count[i])
00462                         dsp_add(out_perform, 5, x, i, sp[i]->s_vec, sp[x->num_outputs + i]->s_vec, sp[i]->s_n);
00463                 else
00464                         dsp_add(out_perform_zero, 2, sp[x->num_outputs + i]->s_vec, sp[i]->s_n);
00465         }
00466 }
00467 
00468 
00469 void out_alloc(t_out *x, int vector_size)
00470 {
00471         if(vector_size != x->vector_size){
00472                 x->vector_size = vector_size;
00473                 x->signal_temp->alloc(vector_size);             
00474                 x->ramp_gain->set_vectorsize(vector_size);
00475                 x->ramp_xfade->set_vectorsize(vector_size);
00476         }
00477 }
